name: Dr. Zimmer

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: There's nothing more to discuss. Now, run along.{dismissive and condescending}

topics.topic: MS03RCHistory1Could I ask you about Rivet City's history?
topics.topic_text: Do you know the history behind Rivet City?
topics.response_text: Looks to me like a giant boat ran aground and a bunch of savages moved in. History lesson over.

topics.topic_text: The android is dead. See, here's an internal component. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: What? Let me see that! This is a Neuro-Servo... Unique to the A3-21... I... And you say you got this from his corpse?

topics.topic_text: I've found your android. It's Harkness, Rivet City's security chief!
topics.response_text: Harkness, you say? Yes... Yes, that makes sense. He used to work for a special branch of the Commonwealth Police, after all...{caught by surprise}

topics.topic_text: So... Any suggestions for finding this android?
topics.response_text: Like I've said, I suspect he's had facial reconstruction, and possibly even a mind wipe.{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: His face job was done here, at Rivet City! By someone named Pinkerton!
topics.response_text: Excellent! Find this Pinkerton and "interview" him. He may very well know the android's whereabouts.{hinting at violent means or breaking and entering}

topics.topic_text: The person who did the surgery and reprogramming is here at Rivet City!
topics.response_text: Really? Here? Surely not one of Doctor Li's trained monkeys...{(to himself) surprised}

topics.topic_text: His memory transfer was done by a tech named Pinkerton. Here at Rivet City!
topics.response_text: Excellent news! We're close... so close.{Shocked and pleased, then becoming patronizing}

topics.topic_text: Okay, so if others have escaped... why are you coming after this one?
topics.response_text: This particular android... Designation A3-21, is... different. Special. The most advanced synthetic humanoid I've ever developed.

topics.topic_text: I'm still looking, don't worry. I'll find him.
topics.response_text: Not soon enough! I don't think I can stand another day in this barbaric backwoods...{unintentionally but definitely condescending.}

topics.topic_text: I need to know more about what I'm dealing with. What is an android exactly?
topics.response_text: Forget everything you know about robots. Those buckets are mere children's toys compared to the real thing.{condescending}

topics.topic_text: Why would an android feel guilt? Come on, Zimmer, what aren't you telling me?
topics.response_text: By God, you're as annoying as you are clever. Very well. I'll tell you what you want to know, if it helps you locate my property.

topics.topic_text: If this android "wandered" off, why would he want a new mind and face?
topics.response_text: Maybe.... MAYBE he didn't exactly wander off. Maybe he fled. Escaped captivity, as it were, if he began to misinterpret his "situation."

topics.topic_text: So tell me about the Commonwealth.
topics.response_text: The Commonwealth itself is nothing but a war-ravaged quagmire of violence and despair. Inside the sealed environment of the Institute, however...{condescending}

topics.topic_text: That depends. What exactly are we talking about, here?
topics.response_text: To the point. I like that. Well, as it turns out, I've misplaced some very sensitive "property."{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: You have a problem with the way I look?
topics.response_text: How amusing. You've mistaken my metaphor for a derogatory remark. I need a local, you see. Someone with verve.{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: I'm listening.
topics.response_text: This could be an opportunity of a lifetime for you! I've misplaced some very sensitive property. And you will help me find it!{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: Missing property? What kind of property?
topics.response_text: Hmmm... how do I put this in a way you'll understand?{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: Cut to the chase, Zimmer. What's the job?
topics.response_text: You'll be searching for an android! Do you know what an android is? No, I imagine you don't.{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: Sounds like slavery to me. You sure they don't "wander off" on purpose?
topics.response_text: Nonsense! This is a machine we're talking about. Can you enslave a generator, or a water purifier? Of course not. The same principle applies.{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: Interesting... But what's this got to do with me, exactly?
topics.response_text: You're helping me retrieve this android! Aren't you?{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: Enough techno-babble, Zimmer. Just tell me what you want me to do.
topics.response_text: Isn't it quite clear? You are to locate my android!{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: I know what an android is. I dabble in AI programming myself.
topics.response_text: Oh. I hadn't realized anyone in the Wasteland was so knowledgeable. And you certainly don't look much like a scientist...{arrogant}

topics.topic_text: I'll be compensated for my services, right?
topics.response_text: Of course. I have at my disposal advanced technology from the Commonwealth.{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: I'm not sure how it is up north, but around here, we get paid for our work.
topics.response_text: I'm sorry, it slipped my mind. I have at my disposal advanced technology from the Commonwealth.{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: Tell me, Zimmer. Is your wallet as big as your mouth?
topics.response_text: How quaint. Of course you'll be rewarded! I have at my disposal advanced technology from the Commonwealth.{unintentionally but definitely condescending}

topics.topic_text: Sorry, I've got better things to do.
topics.response_text: You're as ignorant as all the other rats on this boat. When you realize I have the real cheese, you'll come crawling back. They always do.{arrogant}

topics.topic_text: Sure. I'll look into finding your android for you.
topics.response_text: Excellent. Locate my android, and you won't be disappointed.{arrogant}

conversation.response_text: Why yes! I'm anxious to retrieve him and return to the Commonwealth where he belongs. He's a very expensive piece of equipment.{arrogant}
There you are! I must say, you had me completely fooled. You're very clever A3-21, but not clever enough. Now, come with me!{"A-three-dash-twenty-one"  like an arrogant parent to an ignorant child}
But surely one of you glorified test tube jockeys can assist me? For the most advanced scientific center in the Capital Wasteland, I find your...{condescending}
Stop what you're doing. I have something important to discuss with you.{arrogant}
He's not just a robot!{arrogant and getting angry}
I came to this leaky boat specifically to solicit your help. I'd hoped you "Project Purity" people would be more accommodating.{arrogant}
Yes, of course. I'll watch my alcohol intake.
No sign of him, Armitage. Let's look elsewhere.

description:
Dr. Zimmer is a 58 year-old Caucasian Male.

A human scientist from the Institute who arrived in the Capital Wasteland in 2219 to search for his missing android. He is accompanied by his android bodyguard, Armitage, and is currently located at the Rivet City science lab, though he has been refused assistance by Dr. Madison Li.

Dr. Zimmer's Personality: Determined, persistent, and somewhat arrogant in his pursuit of goals. As a member of the Synth Retention Bureau, he views synths as property rather than sentient beings and is willing to go to great lengths to reclaim them.

Dr. Zimmer's Backstory: Dr. Zimmer was born in 2219 and joined the Institute, where he became part of the Synth Retention Bureau. Later that same year, he left the Institute to conduct a personal search for a missing android, traveling to the Capital Wasteland with his android bodyguard, Armitage. He made his way to Rivet City, hoping that the renowned science lab and its staff, especially Dr. Madison Li, could assist in his search. However, Li personally refused to speak with him, forcing Zimmer to find other means to accomplish his mission.
